channel.title: LatAm Prompt News Feed
channel.description: A daily digest of curated Latin American news.

item.title: LatAm Prompt News Feed - September 10, 2025
item.author: LatAm Prompt News Feed
item.description:
The New Symbol of the Brazilian Right: the American Flag — The New York Times

In a nod to President Trump, Brazil’s nationalist movement has adopted the stars and stripes. Now one flag could be the focus of an investigation involving the N.F.L.

Get to Know Chicago’s Immigrant Community, Target of Trump’s Crackdown — The New York Times

Almost 40 percent of immigrants living in Chicago are from Mexico. More than 800,000 of the city’s 2.7 million residents identify as Hispanic or Latino.

Two Presidents, One Assassination Plot: Brazil’s Trial of the Century — The Wall Street Journal

Brazil’s Supreme Court will decide if former President Jair Bolsonaro tried to stage a coup after the last election and plotted to kill his opponents.

Mexican navy scandal rocks top US cartel-fighting partner — The Financial Times

Several officers arrested in country’s most trusted security institution

Brazil Braces for a Verdict on Its Ex-President—and on Its Democracy — The New Yorker

Jair Bolsonaro faces decades in prison for allegedly attempting a coup after he lost an election. President Trump, like millions of Brazilians, is watching closely.
